channel.title: Which GPU setup would you go with?
channel.description:
I'm going to build a new computer soon, but I'm debating on the two following GPU options:
1) NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 690 4GB GDDR5 OR 2) Dual (SLI) NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 680 2GB GDDR5
Which one would you rather prefer/think would perform the best?

item.title: Which GPU setup would you go with?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:20, topic:518454”]TITAN in SLI. The best solution.[/quote]3 x titans? hope you have 3500$

Read full topic

item.title: Which GPU setup would you go with?
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

[quote=“Stu, post:14, topic:518454”][quote author=Cruel Truth link=topic=636720.msg4294351#msg4294351 date=1367946631]

I think it would be more personal preference…

price wise go with the 690 cause you will be using some major electricity with duo sli’s

performance wise as long as your over 50 fps your good really

Way to just badly summarize what everyone already said in this thread. All these retards trying to get pro post ranks kinda makes me tick.
[/quote]Not sure if serious.

I can play HD runescape with full aliasing with about 50-60 fps. At least to me there is no lag at that fps rate.

It is a true] fact that you will use electricity like hell with duo/trio cards. That’s a general fact with any gaming system/rig.
For the overall efficiency difference it just isn’t worth the housekeeping.

Need those post ranks man.[/quote]Considering I already have 8,792 on my other account I sort of believe your argument is void…

Read full topic

item.source: Which GPU setup would you go with?

item.title: Which GPU setup would you go with?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

SLI will always be better for higher resolution, higher texture games no matter how you chalk it up. Go for the SLI setup if you’re going to be gaming on high resolutions (1920x1080 or more) or if you want to run some custom high textures for games. If you likely won’t be doing either of those things, a single card will use much less power, there will be less heat, it’s usually cheaper and upgrading won’t be too much of a hassle.

Read full topic
item.source: Which GPU setup would you go with?

item.title: Which GPU setup would you go with?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Stu, post:2, topic:518454”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=636720.msg4292699#msg4292699 date=1367617264]
I’m going to build a new computer soon, but I’m debating on the two following GPU options:

  1. NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 690 4GB GDDR5
    OR
  2. Dual (SLI) NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 680 2GB GDDR5

Which one would you rather prefer/think would perform the best?
[/quote]
Dual GTX 680 would WAAAY out-preform the single 690[/quote]
Hardly, plus it takes up a lot more room, electric bill++, bad sli drivers etc.

See benchmarks: http://www.squidoo.com/gtx690-vs-gtx680-sli-review

I have the GTX 680 at the moment, but if I were to pick again I’d pick up the 690 instead of another 680

Read full topic
item.source: Which GPU setup would you go with?
